Articles.Content:
Apparantly they cloned Scott Manley 54 times! No wonder he's capable of having a family, DJ'ing, exploring the boundaries of KSP, tearing things up in EVE online PvP, and still has time to spare for indy games all at the same time haha.

I guess i would describe my stage of KSPness as: "Interplanetary travel! but mostly stuck in kerbin low orbit obsessing over building the most efficient SSTO's"

I am basically Scott Manley. Tis is probably because I played Orbiter 2010 way before ksp and Orbiter is hardcore compared to KSP.

Used mechjeb before, now-never.

Eh, I'm kinda stuck between the "Mun" and "interplanetary travel" options. I haven't been out of Kerbin's SOI yet, not counting a small probe orbiting the sun. On the other hand, docking (in eliptical orbits) is routine, pinpoint landings succeed...most of the time (<500 m), and I've made a working SSTO. Well...

Oh, of course Scott Manley is cloned! A clone of him will come free with the deluxe edition of KSP when it's finished!
Somewhere between going to the Mun and interplanetary, but I play to little to know for sure, and my computer is too potato to even run a 2-part ship at green timer.
This still needs an option above Scott Manley... sure he knows a lot about space flight but he's really not that great at KSP.

I'd say interplanetary travel and back. I'm quite seasoned when it comes to phasing angles, deltaV calculations, and what-not. One thing I've been able to get around though is rendezvous. Sure one day maybe I'll be able to figure it out but for now, I got my ol' friend MechJeb for that.
